intro: Savia laureola, commonly known as the laurel savia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in umbels. The plant is native to parts of Europe and Asia, often found in woodland areas and along riverbanks. Its leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant's botanical features make it both ornamental and ecologically significant in its native habitats.
